title: Why Europe Welcomes Ukrainian Refugees
sub_head: Unlike the 2015 wave, they are mostly women and children who long to return home to their families.
body:
Lviv, Ukraine
Russiaâ€™s brutal invasion has presented Europe with its biggest refugee crisis since World War II. Some 4.9 million Ukrainians have fled their country, according to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees. The last crisis, in 2015, caused political convulsions on the Continent, and it involved only 1.3 million people, mainly from Syria, Afghanistan and Iraq.
